intro: Standleya limae, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the morning glory family, Convolvulaceae, and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers, which are often adorned with a white or pinkish throat. Its leaves are heart-shaped and can be either simple or trifoliate, depending on the variety. Standleya limae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade.
